internetChatbot.title: Internet chatbot
internetChatbot.description: A general purpose chatbot designed to answer queries via the internet

characterRoleplay.title: Character roleplay
characterRoleplay.description: Create an agent to roleplay as a character from a fantasy world

personalAssistant.title: Personal assistant
personalAssistant.description: Chat between a user and a personal assistant designed to enhance the user's productivity

scratch.title: Start from scratch
scratch.description: Start with an empty agent with minimal default tools and a blank initial memory state

customerSupport.title: Customer support
customerSupport.description: An agent designed to answer customer support requests

companion.title: Companion
companion.description: Chat between a user an an AI companion named Sam, designed to learn and adapt over time

exitLoop.title: Exit loop

constrainChildTools.title: Constrain child tools
constrainChildTools.description: Require one tool to follow another tool

conditional.title: Conditional
conditional.description: Run a tool based on a condition from another tool

ADE/AgentVariablesModal.noVariablesInDeployedAgentWithNoTemplate: Variables allow you to programatically define parts of an agent's memory that can be customized per-user on agent creation. Variables are only available in templates - to use variables, click 'Create template' in the top right.

MemoryVariableEditor.keyError: Keys must start with a letter or an underscore and can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores
MemoryVariableEditor.label: Edit Memory Variables
MemoryVariableEditor.notSupported: Memory variables allow you to inject variables into the agent's memory on creation. This feature is only available on our cloud platform.
MemoryVariableEditor.details: Memory variables are injected into the agent's memory on creation. To use a memory variable, simply add it to your core memory with the following syntax: <syntax></syntax>

ToolVariables.noVariables: No tool variables in this agent
ToolVariables.keyError: Keys must start with a letter or an underscore and can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores
ToolVariables.label: Edit tool variables

details.cloud: Tool variables are exposed in tool calls. Agent-scoped tool variables superceed global tool variables. To configure your global tool variables, modify them in your <link>organization settings</link>.
details.local: Tool variables are exposed in tool calls. Agent-scoped tool variables superceed global tool variables set in your computer's environment variables.

ADEOnboarding.welcome: Welcome to your Agent Development Environment (ADE)
ADEOnboarding.description: The ADE is where you can create, edit and deploy your agents. This is your workspace to build and test your agents. Press the button below to take a quick tour of the ADE.

MemoryOnboarding.title: Core Memory
MemoryOnboarding.description: Core Memory is the basis of how you create a letta agent, this content is unique to an agent and can be templated with variables. If you notice there are two tabs, Template, is the initial memory state for any agent you will deploy, and simulated shows off what the specific agent you're talking to's memory looks like.

SimulatedMemory.error: There was an error while reading the simulated memory block, please try again or contact support.

agent.label: Agent
agent.tooltip: The agent core memory is the memory state of the agent that is unique to this agent

templated.label: Template
templated.tooltip: The template memory is the initial memory state for any new deployed agents that use this template

simulated.label: Simulated
simulated.tooltip: The memory state of the simulated agent (reset when you flush the simulator)

ADE/EditCoreMemoriesPanel.title: Core Memory ({count})
ADE/EditCoreMemoriesPanel.infoTooltip: Editable, in-context memory of the agent that can be templated with variables

role.label: Click here to switch roles, the current role is {role}

DetachMemoryBlockDialog.title: Detach Memory Block
DetachMemoryBlockDialog.description: Are you sure you want to detach this memory block? This will remove the memory block from this agent, but any other agents that use this memory block will still have it.

DeleteMemoryBlockDialog.title: Delete Memory Block
DeleteMemoryBlockDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete this memory block? This is permanent and cannot be undone, this will delete the memory block, if this memory block is used in other agents, it will also be deleted from those agents.
DeleteMemoryBlockDialog.error: There was an error deleting this memory block, please try again or contact support.

AgentSimulatorOnboarding.title: Agent Simulator
AgentSimulatorOnboarding.description:
The agent simulator is where you can test your agent's responses and see how it interacts with your agent setup

That's the core part of the ADE, now let's save this template and create an agent from it.

ShareAgentDialog.launchLinkDescription: This agent is managed by a launch link, and cannot be shared.
ShareAgentDialog.title: Share agent chat
ShareAgentDialog.description: Share your agent with others by providing them with a link to this chat
ShareAgentDialog.error: There was an error sharing this agent, please try again or contact support.

everyone.label: Everyone
everyone.description: Anyone with the link can access the agent

organization.label: Organization
organization.description: Only people in your organization can access the agent

loggedIn.label: Logged in
loggedIn.description: Only people logged in to Letta can access the agent

restricted.label: Restricted
restricted.description: Only you can access the agent

ComposioToolsView.description: Composio is an tool integration platform that lets you to easily connect your agent to a wide range of tools and services. Below lists all the products that Composio integrates with. To note, Composio is not open-source nor a part of Letta.

ToolsOnboarding.title: Tools
ToolsOnboarding.description: Tools are a way to extend the functionality of your agent. You can create custom tools, use Letta tools, or connect to external tools via Composio or MCP servers. Tools are essential for your agent to take custom actions.
